page.title: 02THORPE-LE-SOKEN HIGH STREET
page.content: THE HIGH STREET IS A VERY BUSY THOROUGHFARE, BEING PART OF THE MAIN ROUTE FROM COLCHESTER TO THE COASTAL RESORTS OF FRINTON-ON-SEA AND WALTON-ON-THE-NAZE. AT WEEKENDS DURING JULY AND AUGUST TRAFFIC JAMS HAVE BEEN KNOWN TO STRETCH BACK AS FAR AS WEELEY AND KIRBY CROSS. IT BECOMES ALMOST IMPOSSIBLE FOR PEDESTRIANS TO CROSS THE ROAD AND FOR MANY YEARS THE PARISH COUNCIL HAS BEEN CAMPAIGNING FOR A PEDESTRIAN CROSSING BUT TO NO AVAIL. MOST DAY TO DAY SHOPPING CAN BE DONE IN THE HIGH STREET AS THERE ARE TWO BAKERIES, A BUTCHER, A GREENGROCER, A POST OFFICE, NEWSAGENT AND SMALL SUPERMARKET. REGRETFULLY, THE BRANCH OF THE NATWEST BANK CLOSED DOWN LAST YEAR BUT THREE BUILDING SOCIETIES NOW HAVE AGENCIES IN THE VILLAGE. THERE ARE FOUR PUBLIC HOUSES, THE ROSE AND CROWN, MAIDS HEAD, CROWN AND BELL.
